intro: Senecio leptoschizus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Senecio leptoschizus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
